skill.name: dispatching-parallel-agents
skill.description: Use when facing 2+ independent tasks that can be worked on without shared state or sequential dependencies
skill.summary: Use when facing 2+ independent tasks that can be worked on without shared state or sequential depend...
skill.author: Cycleaddict

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only markdown documentation with workflow guidance. No code execution, network calls, file system access, or external commands are present. Pure instructional content about parallel agent dispatching patterns.

content.value_statement: Multiple test failures waste time when investigated sequentially. Parallel agent dispatch sends independent investigations to multiple AI agents, solving several problems in the time it takes to solve one.
actual_capabilities: Identifies independent problem domains across multiple test files
Creates focused agent prompts with clear scope and constraints
Guides dispatch of multiple concurrent AI investigations
Provides verification checklist for reviewing agent fixes
Prevents agent conflicts by defining independent work boundaries
limitations: Only works when failures are truly independent with no shared state
Does not execute code or run tests itself
Requires manual review to integrate agent fixes

use_cases.title: Parallel Test Failure Investigation
use_cases.description: Dispatch multiple agents to fix independent test failures across different files simultaneously

use_cases.title: Multi-Service Debugging
use_cases.description: Investigate failures in multiple microservices at once when issues are isolated to separate subsystems

use_cases.title: Independent Bug Triage
use_cases.description: Split unrelated bugs across multiple agents to accelerate the debugging workflow

prompt_templates.title: Single File Debug
prompt_templates.prompt: Fix the failing tests in {test_file}. The failures are: 1. {failure1} 2. {failure2}. Read the test file, identify root causes, and return a summary of what you found and fixed.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-File Dispatch
prompt_templates.prompt: Task 1: Fix failures in {file1}. Task 2: Fix failures in {file2}. Task 3: Fix failures in {file3}. Each task is independent. Do not modify code outside your assigned file.

prompt_templates.title: Subsystem Investigation
prompt_templates.prompt: Investigate the {subsystem_name} subsystem. {specific_error}. Your goal: understand the root cause and implement a fix. Do not change code in other subsystems.

prompt_templates.title: Integration Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Three agents fixed independent issues in parallel. Review all changes: 1. {summary1} 2. {summary2} 3. {summary3}. Check for conflicts and verify all fixes work together.

output_examples.input: Fix these 3 independent test failures: agent-tool-abort.test.ts has 3 timing issues, batch-completion.test.ts has 2 event bugs, tool-approval.test.ts has 1 async execution issue.
output: ✓ Agent 1 fixed timing issues by replacing arbitrary timeouts with event-based waiting
✓ Agent 2 fixed event structure bugs (threadId placement)
✓ Agent 3 added proper async tool execution waiting
✓ All fixes independent, no conflicts, full test suite passing

best_practices: Verify failures are truly independent before dispatching parallel agents
Provide specific test names, error messages, and file paths in each prompt
Add constraints like 'do not modify production code' or 'fix only your assigned file'
anti_patterns: Too broad: 'Fix all the tests' without specific file or failure context
No constraints: Agent may refactor unrelated code or make unintended changes
Vague output: 'Fix it' without requiring summary of changes made

faq.question: What AI tools support parallel agent dispatch?
faq.answer: Claude, Codex, and Claude Code all support dispatching multiple concurrent tasks or agents.

faq.question: How many agents should I dispatch at once?
faq.answer: Dispatch one agent per independent problem domain. For 3 unrelated failures, dispatch 3 agents.

faq.question: How do I verify agent fixes do not conflict?
faq.answer: Review each summary, check that agents edited different files, and run the full test suite after integration.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this pattern?
faq.answer: This pattern only provides guidance. Each agent sees only the files and context you explicitly share.

faq.question: What if fixes from different agents conflict?
faq.answer: If agents edit the same code, you must manually resolve conflicts. Define clear boundaries to prevent this.

faq.question: When should I NOT use parallel agent dispatch?
faq.answer: Do not use when failures are related, need full system context, or have shared state between investigations.
